posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
Are you using an external encoder? The rev encoders are “RelativeEncoder” which I don’t see an import for, they would be obtained from sparkmax.getEncoder() if that’s what you’re looking for.

A link to github or another source to access full code would be great because I’m struggling to interpret the issue based on just this info.
Will the relative encoder still work if we want to know the absolute position for a through bore encoder?

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked: Do you have an absolute encoder connected to an absolute encoder board connected to the sparkmax? If so, you would use sparkmax.getAbsoluteEncoder() to get that encoder object.

No. We just plug in the through bore encoder into the DIO port. Here is our code. GitHub - redlandsrobotics/2025Reefscape Last year we had no issues whatsoever with the same code

thx btw

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
No problem. What I can see so far is that you’re trying to use “reset” on both RelativeEncoders and DutyCycleEncoders. It looks like DutyCycleEncoders do not have a method to set a positional offset, and REV’s relative encoders use “setPosition” this year. Hope this helps, I’ve gotta get off but I’ll take another look tomorrow and hopefully some other people can give insight too.

DutyCycleEncoder (WPILib API 2025.3.1) (used in your armsubsystem)

RelativeEncoder (FRC-REVLib API) (used in your wrist subsystem)

I am not familiar with driveMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults() but I’d guess that it has been replaced with the overhaul of the rev config api. Here are those docs: SparkBaseConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

Encoder.getdistance() might need to be replaced with getPosition().

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
kr1699:

I am not familiar with driveMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults() but I’d guess that it has been replaced with the overhaul of the rev config api.

Correct, it has

Thanks so much

Do you know what happened to methods like getRotation()? Also getPosition() doesn’t seem to work. These ones are pretty crucial to our code, and I can’t find anything like them in the DutyCycleEncoder docs.

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
IMG_8824 1170×183 41.7 KB

IMG_8824 1170×183 41.7 KB

IMG_8824 1170×183 41.7 KB

I think this would be what you’re looking for. I’m not sure what happened to the previous methods. I don’t have experience with any of the WPIlib encoder classes, but I know rev underwent several significant changes like the config overhaul and replacing smartmotion with MAXMotion, so if you’re missing any of their methods then that’s probably why.
